title: Call to Power II...
content:
Has anyone heard of a Civ-type game called Call to Power II? If not, then I feel sorry for you. It is simply the best game in its genre I have played - addictive, long-lasting, and utterly Keenish in its glory.

You have your Ancient, Renaissance and Modern Ages like other Civ-type games, but, like Empire Earth, you get sci-fi ages - the the Genetic and Diamond Ages. Once the game gets to that level, juicy sci-fi stuff comes in...[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img]

You can play as many different civs, not just the regular ones, but also a few nifty minor groups such as the Polynesians, Ethiopians, Indonesians etc. The Australians are also in the game, so LL can vent her rage against Australia in a safe and civilised (scuse the pun) manner...[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Australia, n. A country lying in the South Sea, whose industrial and commercial development has been unspeakably retarded by an unfortunate dispute among geographers as to whether it is a continent or an island.
Thomas Nashe
- The Devil's Dictionary

[url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?Kangarus%20Gyrfalcon]Weird information on all sorts of weird and wonderful people![/url]
